questions.question: How do cybercriminals make use of a malicious iFrame?

options.text: The attacker redirects traffic to an incorrect DNS server.
The iFrame allows multiple DNS subdomains to be used.
The attacker embeds malicious content in business appropriate files.
The iFrame allows the browser to load a web page from another source.

questions.explanation: An inline frame or iFrame is an HTML element that allows the browser to load a different web page from another source.

questions.question: In which way does the use of HTTPS increase the security monitoring challenges within enterprise networks?

options.text: HTTPS traffic does not require authentication.
HTTPS traffic is much faster than HTTP traffic.
HTTPS traffic can carry a much larger data payload than HTTP can carry.

questions.explanation: HTTPS enables end-to-end encrypted network communication, which adds further challenges for network administrators to monitor the content of packets to catch malicious attacks.

questions.question: Which network service synchronizes the time across all devices on the network?
questions.explanation: The NTP keeps the time across all devices synchronized by using a hierarchical system of sources.

questions.question: Which type of server daemon accepts messages sent by network devices to create a collection of log entries?
questions.explanation: Syslog creates a collection of log entries by accepting messages from network devices.

questions.question: What port number would be used if a threat actor was using NTP to direct DDoS attacks?
questions.explanation: NTP uses UDP port number 123. Threat actors could use port 123 on NTP systems in order to direct DDoS attacks through vulnerabilities in client or server software.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to send e-mail messages between two servers that are in different e-mail domains?
questions.explanation: SMTP is used to send data between mail servers and to send data from a host to a mail server.

questions.question: What type of server can threat actors use DNS to communicate with?
questions.explanation: Some malware uses DNS to communicate with command-and-control (CnC) servers to exfiltrate data in traffic that is disguised as normal DNS query traffic.

questions.question: Which type of server would support the SMTP, POP, and IMAP protocols?
questions.explanation: The Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) is used to send email. The Post Office Protocol (POP) and Internet Message Access Protocol (IMAP) are used to retrieve email.

questions.question: What method allows VPN traffic to remain confidential?
questions.explanation: Plain text data that is transported over the Internet can be intercepted and read. The data should be encrypted to keep it private.

questions.question: To facilitate the troubleshooting process, which inbound ICMP message should be permitted on an outside interface?
questions.explanation: By allowing the ICMP echo reply message inbound to the organization, internal users are allowed to ping external addresses (and the reply message allowed to return).

questions.question: Which statement describes the function provided by the Tor network?

options.text: It manipulates packets by mapping IP addresses between two networks.
It conceals packet contents by establishing end-to-end tunnels.
It distributes user packets through load balancing.
It allows users to browse the Internet anonymously.

questions.explanation: The Tor network allows users to browse the Internet anonymously.

questions.question: How can NAT/PAT complicate network security monitoring if NetFlow is being used?

options.text: It hides internal IP addresses by allowing them to share one or a few outside IP addresses.
It disguises the application initiated by a user by manipulating port numbers.
It changes the source and destination MAC addresses.
It conceals the contents of a packet by encrypting the data payload.

questions.explanation: NAT/PAT maps multiple internal IP addresses with only a single or a few outside IP addresses breaking end-to-end flows. The result makes it difficult to log the inside device that is requesting and receiving the traffic.

questions.question: A cyberanalyst is reviewing an entry-point ACL. What three types of ICMP traffic should be allowed to access an internal network from the internet? (Choose three.)
questions.explanation: ACLs should only permit special types of ICMP messages to enter an internal network. Allowed ICMP traffic includes an ICMP reply, source quench (squelch), and any ICMP unreachable messages.

questions.question: A company decides to purchase a device capable of managing load balancing so that traffic will be distributed between their servers. What could be a potential problem using the new device on the network?

options.text: All links to redundant servers will require encrypted tunneling protocols.
It will cause extra traffic going to a server resource that is not available.
The LBM probe messages may appear as suspicious traffic.
It will require the purchase of more servers so that existing servers are not overwhelmed.
The traffic will require more bandwidth to send to multiple servers.

questions.explanation: LBM devices may send probes to different servers to detect that the servers are operating. These probes can appear to be suspicious traffic.
